EXISTING STRUCTURES
────────────────────────
### Resource Depot & Smelting Facility at base position (x=-4.5, y=18.5)
Consists of:
• Wooden Chest at (x=-4.5, y=18.5) serving as central storage.
• Stone Furnace at (x=-3.0, y=19.0) for iron smelting.
• Stone Furnace at (x=-4.0, y=21.0) for copper plate production.
• Burner Inserter at (x=0.5, y=21.5) with drop at (x=0.5, y=20.5)

### Automation Lab & Steam Power System (Integrated System) at base configuration
Consists of:
• Lab at (x=-7.5, y=18.5) dedicated to automation research.
 – Electricity Group comprising:
  • Existing small electric poles at (x=-0.5, y=11.5), (x=-7.5, y=15.5), (x=-4.5, y=15.5), (x=3.5, y=19.5) and (x=1.5, y=22.5).
  • Additional poles at (x=-7.5, y=16.5) and (x=-8.5, y=13.5); note the previously attempted pole at (x=-10.5, y=18.5) remains unconnected.
  • Merged network poles at (x=-17.5, y=13.5) and (x=-17.5, y=16.5).
 – Steam Engines:
  • Primary steam engine at (x=-13.5, y=16.5) with status NOT_CONNECTED.
  • Additional engines at (x=-14.5, y=13.5), (x=7.5, y=35.5) and (x=8.5, y=20.5) as previously detailed.
 – Fluid System Submodule – Boiler Module:
  • Pre-existing Boiler at (x=-13.5, y=19.0) (rotated; connection points at (x=-15.5, y=18.5) and (x=-11.5, y=18.5)) remains NOT_CONNECTED.
  • Intermediate pipe at (x=-17.5, y=21.5) attempted to bridge connection with the pre-existing Boiler, but the fluid link failed.
  • New Boiler and Steam Engine Pair:
   – New Boiler at (x=-14.0, y=16.5) (final status NOT_CONNECTED; multiple fluid connection attempts were made – an eventual attempt using sufficient pipes registered a successful connection message, yet status remains unchanged, and water supply connection remains unresolved).
   – New Steam Engine at (x=-7.5, y=11.5) (final status NOT_CONNECTED).
   – Fluid connection between the new pair has been reattempted several times, with initial failures due to insufficient pipe inventory and a subsequent successful pipe connection attempt that did not fully resolve integration issues. A water supply connection to the new Boiler was also attempted but encountered errors.

### Remote Fluid Integration System at remote region (approximate center: x=-30, y=40)
Consists of:
• Offshore Pump at (x=-30.5, y=37.5) operating (status: WORKING).
• Boiler at (x=-29.0, y=33.5) for fluid heating.
• Pipe Connection established via a PipeGroup starting at (x=-30.5, y=31.5) through (x=-30.5, y=34.5) in sequential segments.

────────────────────────
ERROR TIPS
• Pipe Crafting and Resource Shortage:
 – Ensure that sufficient sub-ingredients (such as iron plates) are available before initiating pipe crafting. The repeated crafting failures indicate that production of required iron plates must be carefully supported by smelting operations or available crafting machinery.

• Fluid Connection Failures:
 – Confirm that the pipe inventory meets the requirements (e.g., 33 pipes) prior to attempting fluid connections.
 – Verify that both source and target connection points are clear and properly aligned along the intended fluid path.
 – Reassess intermediate positions to avoid obstructions; despite an eventual attempt yielding a positive connection message, the new Boiler and Steam Engine remain unintegrated.

• Water Supply Connection Errors:
 – Avoid calling Position objects as functions to prevent TypeError issues; ensure proper syntax when accessing attributes.
 – Validate the pathfinding process from the current player position (e.g., x=-1.5, y=18.5) to the water source (e.g., x=-26.0 to x=-26.5, y≈60.25) to resolve routing errors.
 – Confirm that water source positions are accurately determined and reachable to establish a stable water supply connection.

• Network Stabilization and Connection Reevaluation:
 – Allow sufficient stabilization time after connection attempts before reassessing system status.
 – Double-check inventory levels and positional data prior to reattempting both fluid and water connections.

Additional general guidelines on placement accuracy, resource management, and entity retrieval from previous operations remain applicable.
